person.persName: John Crepps Wickliffe (Nelson County, KY, attorney, politician, and soldier (CSA))

body.p: Nelson County, Kentucky, attorney, politician, and soldier. Nelson County, Kentucky, native. Son of Charles A. Wickliffe and Margaret Crepps Wickliffe. Married to Eleanor Wickliffe on November 2, 1853. Father of John C. Wickliffe, Charles A. Wickliffe, Mary Wickliffe, Margaret Wickliffe, and Ellenor Wickliffe. Attended Centre College in Danville, Kentucky. Law student in Nelson County in 1850. Household owned twenty-five enslaved persons in Nelson County in 1850. Admitted to the bar in 1853. Attorney in Nelson County. Member of the House of Representatives of the Commonwealth of Kentucky from 1857 to 1859. Secretary of the Senate of the Commonwealth of Kentucky in 1859. Employed [Unknown] Leeman as a gardener and Ellen McTaggart as a nurse in Nelson County in 1860. Owned five enslaved persons in Nelson County in 1860. Served in the 9th Kentucky Volunteer Mounted Infantry Regiment (C.S.A.) as captain from October 2, 1861, to May 1862; major from May 1862 to April 22, 1863; and lieutenant colonel from April 22, 1863.
